data.title: Best Sherlock Holmes Novels: Meet The World’s Smartest Detective Ever (2023)
data.meta_description: Embark on the crime-solving journey with Sherlock Holmes novels and bring justice to the table. Here are the four novels and fifty-six short stories about Sherlock Holmes.
data.text:
Synopsis

A collection of detective novels authored by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Sherlock Holmes Novels are about the world’s smartest detective, Sherlock Holmes and his loyal friend and biographer, Dr John Watson. Together they solve various mysteries and crimes in the city of London set in the Victorian era. If these two sentences intrigue you enough to buy these novels, then go ahead with the article to find the buying links for the same.

Author Sir Arthur Conan Doyle created history by painting one of the most loved literary characters of the world: Sherlock Holmes. He is said to have a striking appearance, with sharp features and piercing eyes with incredible intelligence, deductive reasoning, and attention to detail. In the book series, he is said to have keen observation and logical analysis which he uses to solve seemingly unsolvable mysteries and crimes.

Dr John Watson, his loyal friend and biographer, is the narrator of all of his stories and provides an intriguing insight into the characters of the detective. Also, the novels are set in Victorian England and the duo of these two characters are seen investigating a wide range of crimes, from murder to theft.

Although written centuries ago, the novels are still captivating readers of all ages with their intricate plots, vivid characters, and the masterful storytelling of the author. Get ready to engage yourself in timeless stories, eventful plotlines, unforgettable characters and so much more with the suggestions mentioned in this article.

We have shared separate links for all four Sherlock Holmes novels along with one for the complete bundle. After this, you will find links to the five books with 56 short stories about Sherlock Holmes.

List of the Best Sherlock Holmes Novels

1. A Study in Scarlet by Arthur Conan Doyle

The first novel in the 4 novels of Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle, "A Study in Scarlet" was published in 1887. This is the iconic book that introduced the world to the eminent detective character, Sherlock Holmes who later goes on to become extremely famous and beloved by the world. The readers are also introduced to the narrator of the book, Dr John Watson who also happens to be a loyal friend and biographer of Sherlock Holmes. The first book shows the readers how Sherlock solves a murder that takes place in London using a rare poison. What turns the plotline are the cryptic clues written in blood left behind by the murderer.

Buy Now: A Study in Scarlet (Paperback)

2. The Sign of the Four by Arthur Conan Doyle

"The Sign of the Four,” the second novel of the Sherlock Holmes novels list by Arthur Conan Doyle was published in 1890. Narrated on the same lines as the first one, this detective novel showcases a plot where a young woman named Mary Morstan approaches Holmes and Watson to seek their assistance in solving the mystery of her missing father. The duo agrees to investigate the missing case which leads them to a complex web of greed, revenge, and betrayal, ultimately culminating in a tense standoff in the dark heart of London. Along with the mind-churning detective story, you also get to experience the personalities and relationships of Holmes and Watson on a deeper level which adds depth and nuance to these iconic characters.

Buy Now: The Sign of the Four (Paperback)

3. The Hound of the Baskervilles by Arthur Conan Doyle

The next, third of the Sherlock Holmes novels list by Arthur Conan Doyle is "The Hound of the Baskervilles" which was published in 1902. The novel is written around a murder plot investigated by the same iconic duo mentioned in the other books. The murder is not just any murder but the mysterious death of Sir Charles Baskerville, who died of a heart attack supposedly caused by a curse from a spectral hound that haunts the Baskerville family. Considered one of the best Sherlock Holmes books, the book also features a deeper mystery that puts the last Baskerville heir in grave danger which keeps the readers hooked to the book until the last page.

Buy Now: The Hound of the Baskervilles (Paperback)

4. The Valley of Fear by Arthur Conan Doyle

Last but not least of the 4 novels of Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle is "The Valley of Fear" published in 1915. This story which is divided into two parts takes place in Sussex, England followed by the United States making it really interesting and worth a read. The plot of the story strikes the readers with the murder of a wealthy Englishman in his own home, a case which is investigated by Holmes. Holmes is led to reach a sinister American organization known as the Scowrers, and their leader, a ruthless criminal named Birdy Edwards.

Buy Now: The Valley of Fear (Paperback)

5. The Complete Novels of Sherlock Holmes (Deluxe Hardbound Edition) by Arthur Conan Doyle

If you do not want to buy all these four Sherlock Holmes books series, then we suggest you check out the following link and buy the complete book set. It is The Complete Novels of Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle in Deluxe Hardbound Edition which shall be great if you like to collect books.

Buy Now: The Complete Novels of Sherlock Holmes (Deluxe Hardbound Edition)

6. The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle

Published in the year 1892, “The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes" by Arthur Conan Doyle is a collection of 12 stories about the iconic duo of Sherlock Holmes and Dr John Watson. Here is the list of the short stories shared in the book:

1. "A Scandal in Bohemia"

2. "The Adventure of the Red-Headed League"

3. "A Case of Identity"

4. "The Boscombe Valley Mystery"

5. "The Five Orange Pips"

6. "The Man with the Twisted Lip"

7. "The Adventure of the Blue Carbuncle"

8. "The Adventure of the Speckled Band"

9. "The Adventure of the Engineer's Thumb"

10. "The Adventure of the Noble Bachelor"

11. "The Adventure of the Beryl Coronet"

12. "The Adventure of the Copper Beeches"

Buy Now: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes (Paperback)

7. The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle

Containing 11 short stories involving the world-renowned character Sherlock Holmes and his loyal friend Dr John Watson, “The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes” by Arthur Conan Doyle was published in 1894. All of these story titles are mentioned below which were originally published in The Strand Magazine between 1892 and 1893 and were later turned into this book. Also, "The Final Problem" was supposed to be the last story featuring Sherlock Holmes but his admirers didn’t take his demise well and Doyle had to bring it back in the later stories.

1. "Silver Blaze"

2. "The Yellow Face"

3. "The Stock-broker's Clerk"

4. "The Gloria Scott"

5. "The Musgrave Ritual"

6. "The Reigate Puzzle"

7. "The Crooked Man"

8. "The Resident Patient"

9. "The Greek Interpreter"

10. "The Naval Treaty"

11. "The Final Problem"

Buy Now: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes (Paperback)

8. The Return of Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle

Published in 1905, "The Return of Sherlock Holmes" by Arthur Conan Doyle is a book containing 13 stories about Sherlock Holmes and his partner Dr John Watson. These stories were also published in the Strand Magazine from 1903 to 1904 and later compiled into this book.

1. "The Adventure of the Empty House"

2. "The Adventure of the Norwood Builder"

3. "The Adventure of the Dancing Men"

4. "The Adventure of the Solitary Cyclist"

5. "The Adventure of the Priory School"

6. "The Adventure of Black Peter"

7. "The Adventure of Charles Augustus Milverton"

8. "The Adventure of the Six Napoleons"

9. "The Adventure of the Three Students"

10. "The Adventure of the Golden Pince-Nez"

11. "The Adventure of the Missing Three-Quarter"

12. "The Adventure of the Abbey Grange"

13. "The Adventure of the Second Stain"

Buy Now: The Return of Sherlock Holmes (Paperback)

9. His Last Bow: Some Reminiscences of Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle

"His Last Bow: Some Reminiscences of Sherlock Holmes” was published in the year 1917 containing 8 stories which are mentioned below. Once again our author, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle intended to end the tales of Sherlock Holmes, hence the name. However, the author ended up writing another collection for his readers because he can’t disappoint Sherlock fans after all.

1. “The Adventure of Wisteria Lodge”

2. “The Adventure of the Cardboard Box”

3. “The Adventure of the Red Circle”

4. “The Adventure of the Bruce-Partington Plans”

5. “The Adventure of the Dying Detective”

6. “The Disappearance of Lady Frances Carfax”

7. “The Adventure of the Devil's Foot”

8. “His Last Bow (The War Service of Sherlock Holmes)”

Buy Now: His Last Bow: Some Reminiscences of Sherlock Holmes (Paperback)

10. The Case-Book of Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle

Finally the last and best Sherlock Holmes book of 12 short stories featuring the iconic character, "The Case-Book of Sherlock Holmes" by Arthur Conan Doyle was published in 1927. The complete list of the titles of these short stories is mentioned below:

1. “The Illustrious Client”

2. “The Blanched Soldier”

3. “The Mazarin Stone”

4. “The Three Gables”

5. “The Sussex Vampire”

6. “The Three Garridebs”

7. “The Problem of Thor Bridge”

8. “The Creeping Man”

9. “The Lion's Mane”

10. “The Veiled Lodger”

11. “Shoscombe Old Place”

12. “The Retired Colourman”

Buy Now: The Case-Book of Sherlock Holmes (Paperback)

Frequently Asked Questions: Best Sherlock Holmes Novels

Q1. How many Sherlock Holmes books are there?

Ans: There are a total of four Sherlock Holmes novels in the market followed by 56 short stories featuring the beloved Sherlock Holmes character which are divided into 5 books.

Q2. Can a 14-year-old read Sherlock Holmes?

Ans: Yes. Anyone with a decent grasp of the language can read Sherlock Holmes novels. The authors have used uncomplicated language making the stories very easy to read and understand.

Q3. Is Sherlock Holmes okay for the kids?

Ans: Although Sherlock Holmes is said to be okay for kids but owing to its Violence & Scariness, the books are fit for teenagers only. In addition to this, the parents of the children should supervise what their kids are reading.
